query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 La molta gente e le diverse piaghe 2 avean le luci mie sì inebrïate, 3 che de lo stare a piangere eran vaghe.
query.error: **English:** 1 The many people and the diverse wounds 2 had so clouded my vision 3 that I longed to stop and weep.
query.result: 1 Þa menigu and ða mislican wunda 2 hæfdon swa ða mine eagan afyllede, 3 ðæt ic ðæs wependes wæs wilnunga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Ma Virgilio mi disse: «Che pur guate? 5 perché la vista tua pur si soffolge 6 là giù tra l’ombre triste smozzicate?
query.error: **English:** 4 But Virgil said to me: "Why do you gaze so intently? 5 Why does your sight linger so fixedly 6 down there among the sad and mutilated shades?
query.result: 4 Ac Virgilius cwæð to me: "Hwæt ðu ðus wundað? 5 Hwi ðin gesiho ðus fæste lociað 6 ðær niðer betwux ðam sarigean sceade?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Tu non hai fatto sì a l’altre bolge; 8 pensa, se tu annoverar le credi, 9 che miglia ventidue la valle volge.
query.error: **English:** 7 You have not done so in the other circles; 8 consider, if you think to count them, 9 that the valley makes a turn of twenty-two miles."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 E già la luna è sotto i nostri piedi; 11 lo tempo è poco omai che n’è concesso, 12 e altro è da veder che tu non vedi».
query.error: **English:** 10 And now the moon is beneath our feet; 11 the time is short that is allotted to us, 12 and there is more to see than you can see.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 «Se tu avessi», rispuos’ io appresso, 14 «atteso a la cagion per ch’io guardava, 15 forse m’avresti ancor lo star dimesso».
query.error: **English:** 13 "If you had," I answered him then, 14 "waited for the reason why I was looking, 15 perhaps you would have let me stay there still."
query.result: 13 "Gif ðu hæfdest," ic ða andswarode, 14 "abiden ðære tide ðe ic sceolde, 15 ðonne mihte ðu ðæt wunian forlæten."

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 16 He gewende ða, and ic æfter him eode, 17 se heretoga, ða ða andsware macode, 18 and ðus cwæð to me: "On ðære hole

19 dov’ io tenea or li occhi sì a posta, 20 credo ch’un spirto del mio sangue pianga 21 la colpa che là giù cotanto costa».

query.result: 19 ðær ic ða mine eagan fæste hæfde, 20 ic wene ðæt sum gast of ðinum cynne wepe 21 ða synne ðe ðær swa deore cysteð."

query.result: 28 ðu wære ða swa swiðe ofsett 29 ofer ðone ðe iu ða heoldan hæfde, 30 ðæt ðu ne locodæst furðor, ða he ðanon gewat."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 fece lui disdegnoso; ond’ el sen gio 35 sanza parlarmi, sì com’ ïo estimo: 36 e in ciò m’ha el fatto a sé più pio».

query.result: 34 ðæt hine forð geswencte; ða he ðanon gewat 35 ðurh ða spræce min, swa ic ðæt geseah: 36 and ðurh ðæt he me ðæs geornor wæs."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Così parlammo infino al loco primo 38 che de lo scoglio l’altra valle mostra, 39 se più lume vi fosse, tutto ad imo.
query.error: **English:** 37 Thus we spoke until we reached the first place 38 from which the cliff shows the other valley, 39 if there were more light, all the way to the bottom.
query.result: 37 Þus we spræcon oð ðone forman stow 38 ðær ðæs clifes ða oðre denu sceawað, 39 gif ðær mare leoht wære, eall niðer.
